title: @Riotrepertoir: about aatrox
body:
This guy really should be a juggernaut. I posted some ideas in another thread about how to make him unique.

Right now he plays sort of like a melee adc because hes so weak and squishy you absolutely must hurry to get both lifesteal and tank items on him, and even then he just gets mowed down unless there's a solid threat on your team.

Some places I would remove some power:

Passive: I would just remove the self resurrect because outside of early turret dives its junk. I don't care that it's up more often. This just equates to the enemy team circle jerking around your body to finish killing you. This should really be reworked into another passive that benefits his other abilities when his bloodwell is filled and gives him some stats. Give him more means to also then fill the bloodwell and spend it.

Q: This is some hidden BS potential power. They say it's like a mini malphite ult, except it has an ENORMOUS delay, terrible range, and you essentially CC yourself in place to eat a boatload of damage and CC. Aside from all that, it is absurdly easy to dodge. Get rid of this crummy knockup and give him some real mobility in place of it, or something else entirely.

W: You can go ahead and remove the toggle from this and just make the lifesteal passive, because right now he can hardly afford to use the damage component. This should really have some sort of active defensive ability tied to it with just passive heal every third hit.

E: This is actually a solid ability and fun to use, but its pretty darn generic.

R: A stat stick ultimate with zero real interaction. Remove the damage, give it a team attack speed buff for duration and a very brief AE fear.

I posted another thread on how to spice aatrox up. He really should be a juggernaut. If you have to get rid of Q, then do it. We all hate that ability.

This is your drain tank fantasy right here. And the way you need to play it out is with his blood well passive as a resource that you generate and spend. Most of his abilities should probably come at a cost of life, maybe heftier, but then he needs to have better base stats. This guy should really be spending and generating life as a resource that ties into his bloodwell passive. As such, he should have more ways to heal. You could easily remove some of his damage.

Also the knockup is silly, the guy thematically should have a fear tied to his ultimate.

replies.body:
One of the things that we have generally thought is important for juggernauts is that their mobility profile is such that they don't really have abilities that grant them instant access to where they want to be, and Aatrox's Q is in pretty direct conflict with that. That's not to say it's entirely out of the question. There are thematic elements of him and sustained damage patterns on him that really do actually fit in pretty well.

>  If you have to get rid of Q, then do it. We all hate that ability.

I'm curious as to whether the above statement is true of most Aatrox players, or if you were generalizing here. If any other Aatrox players could chime in with their opinions, I'd certainly be interested in hearing them.

I want Aatrox's ult to be replace with Old Sion ult. The one that gains bonus lifesteal and 50% attack speed and basic attacks will heal surrounding allies for a percentage of the damage dealt.

That would be fantastic on Aatrox and goes with his lore too.

I play Aatrox often and a lot, more lately with the release of Sated, so I'm just gonna throw my 2 cents in.

Passive: Completely vulnerable after his revive stasis. Not to mention he has no chance at sustaining after the blood well absorbs all his bonus attack speed. Late into the game, his revive with a full blood well revives him for about 900~ health, which isn't the greatest if the opponents can set up a lock-down when he comes out of it.

Q: It has a very long start up. I read recently that someone suggested reducing the cast time the shorter it is to him, much like Soraka's Starcall. That would really help for set ups and quick reactions. 
The one thing I hated most when Q'ing, is dying when using it, while with anyone else with a dash would make it away in time. Possibly give it a short frame of invulnerability at the top of his flight path? Fizz is invulnerable at the top of his pole, whilst Aatrox can get bodied flying above everyone. 
Maybe slow them after his Q or add a small slow radius outside of his knockup range?
All in all, his Q isn't that strong, especially when its easily channeled with such a long cast time. 
Buff it one way or another, but at the moment it's in an unreliable spot. 

W: The heal is nice, but the active is a lil underwhelming, especially when you're playing him in lane or whatnot. You'd have to build Armor pen to get the full affect of the bonus damage, and I believe his active is the only bonus damage in the game that doesn't proc lifesteal. Maybe allow it to proc lifesteal? 
Maybe change the damage to Magic damage to increase his strength as a hybrid damage dealer? (E and Ult are Magic Damage)

E: Love it, no problem at all here. Move along.

R: It's a Yi ultimate that doesn't increase movement speed and is affected by slows. The damage is subpar, considering it scales with ap, which no one builds (At least after DFG was removed - Q-DFG-Ult-E-GG).
Nerf the damage and attack speed buff. Make the damage scale with HP, so it rewards tankier builds, allowing him more utility. 
One idea I've had was this. His lore states that he turns battles around single handedly. Possibly he can heal allies near him based off of the amount he lifesteals? Maybe just base it off a percentage of damage he deals? Maybe even just a flat rate per auto attack. 
Give him something more than just a self buff, when his lore it says armies benefit from his presence.

No one's saying to rework him, not even do every suggestion people are asking, but make him more reliable.

**Tl;dr, Passive Revive is unreliable, Q is unreliable as an escape and easily channeled, W damage is unreliable, Ult is linear and just a combination of other champions' ablities.**

I'm just picking up Aatrox, again, but if I were to evaluate his kit-

Q: Love it.  I would like to see the range slightly increased.  

W: I also love it, though the cost seems to be a little too detrimental in fights.

E: Could use a touch more range, and a slightly shorter cast animation.

R: This ability feels wrong when I cast it.  It doesn't do a meaningful amount of damage.  It's counter intuitive because you will want to auto more but the cast time in the animation ensures you will die if you activate it inside of a team fight.  Maybe take the aoe damage off and increase the range on his abilities, keep the AS buff because that's what its mainly for but take off the aoe damage component because you should be wanting to use this earlier in an engage.


Overall Aatrox: If I were to propose a new kit setup this is what I would propose. 

Passive: When Aatrox deals damage X% is stored in a bloodwell.  His abilities can tap into the blood to increase their effects.  Attack Damage is also increased based on how much blood is stored.

Q: Aatrox rises then dives to the ground at a target location dealing X damage and knocking up opponents.  The damage is increased for how much blood he has stored. 

W: Toggle- 
'On' every third auto attack deals bonus damage increased for how much blood is stored.  Consumes x% of the blood stored
'Off' every third auto attack heals Aatrox increased for how much blood is stored.  Consumes x% of the blood stored

E: Fires two blade that intersect at a point dealing damage and slowing all enemies hit.  The damage and slow is increased for how much blood is stored. 

R: Passive- Bloodwell generation is increased by (.25/.5/.75)
Active: Creates a zone where all damage received by enemies from any source is stored into his bloodwell.

The purpose of this setup would be to balance attack speed and damage.  If you built too much damage you would be useless in the aspect that you'd have nothing coming out of your w and if you built too much speed you'd also have no blood well to use your w or other abilities with.  The R is more for a team fight changer and is more a result of his lore. With a setup similar to this he would be much more strategic in fights and would have obvious weaknesses and strengths.

Hi I main Aatrox and can confirm, Q is his worst ability.

Rework him nao rito pls

I am a aatrox player with around 400 games on ranked with him. The q should be made to an insta stun in a radius around him giving him more reliable form of cc and helping him in dueling and team fights but the problem there is that he has no gap closer. Maybe chance some other ability of his to a gap closer. I like the W toggle blood price (you can do good dmg with it) if played right you can win lane early if you know what you are doing. Maybe instead of bonus ad dmg he wold to bonus ap dmg so that lane opponents can't itemse so easily against aatrox. I don't like his passive revive it leaves you to vournable. When it is down it leaves you at a bigger disadvantage compared to other top lane champions when they die because they don't lose a safety net. And another problem with his passive is that you lose all your bonus attack speed when you revive.

Q (and E, and R) just feel incredibly bland in context. They don't have any real interaction with his kit beyond "let this guy attack people" (through bonus attack range, repositioning, and crowd control), so it's pretty hard to feel like any of them have a real cool impact on his kit. Compare to Darius's Q, which helps spread his Hemo stacks (*especially* with his new Innate) on multiple targets, allowing him to set up for an ult chain, or Olaf's Q, which gives him sticking power that forces him to keep moving forward (which is unique to his unstoppable Berserker playstyle), or Tahm's Q, which allows him to slowly slather his opponents up from afar (or speed up the rate at which he does it in melee) and makes him into the dangerous close-range CC machine he is. 

The only mechanics that really feel like they belong on Aatrox are his Innate and W, which emphasize a more consistent/ramping power while in combat with a combination of offense and defense. Q and E feel like they're more geared for burst initiation champs like Malphite and Sejuani (in fact, it just feels like a worse Malphite ult, and watching him slam his head into the ground is kinda silly), and his ult's just...a really boring steroid. 

I know a lot of time and effort went into creating Aatrox, but he feels really uninspired next to champs like Tahm, Bard, Gnar, Twisted Fate, the new Fiora, etc. Not expecting an update anytime soon, but I hope he gets one eventually.

Astrox player here

Passive: Should include some scaling like what they did with Morde's so that it can scale and not just a stat stick. It is also annoying knowing that when you go down and are cornered, it's doesn't feel magestic at all going down while your BW drains, losing your AS bonus and becoming a chunk of meat. Be interesting that for X seconds after he "dies" with it, he keeps the AS bonus temporarly so that he isn't immediately weak when he recovers.

Q: I like the ability. However, I dislike how easy it is for the enemy to cancel it and I remain in place to get my butt whooped. Like yes, a mini knockup is great but I don't think it's worth the windup that can be disrupted if you're using it to go on the defense. It fits his theme, to dive head first into battle. But that windup is my biggest complaint. I'd be fine with removing the knockup for the removal of the windup honestly. 

W: Feels awful for the first half the game using blood price at all until I get a big LS item. Doesn't feel rewarding until then. I just constantly keep Blood Thirst on to out sustain. Oh, a pre-9 duel? Just keep Blood Thirst for that sustain. Oh, you have pots? Well I got pots and your minions are healing me quite nicely thanks. Even after I get a decent amount of LS, I'm always worried if I'll be helping them-kill-me faster more than me-killing-them if I use Blood Price. Deals good damage late game, just that fear in the back of my mind. Especially if my team is behind.

E: Good trading tool. Decent cost, does magic damage so the enemy can't completely build against me. I like it.

R: Oh boy. Well first, doesn't really play up the fantasy of "inspires a bloodthirsty army" that he gets in his lore. Biggest complaint I had when I saw him hit the PBE. I love the AS buff, range buff, and the model change is cool. Damage is a nice surprise to get a sudden kill if my E and auto can't do the job. Just walk in, and ult. But the scaling, why? Like sure HTGB is a cool niche item for him, but it doesn't feel worth replacing it over any other LS item just to boost your E and ult's damage in a small amount. If the scaling was more I might consider HTGB a mandatory, but for now it's just a surprise burst damage with a AS steroid that doesn't deliver the fantasy told in his lore.

Ideas for the ult could be:
1. Change the scaling on his ult to AD
2. (Please don't do this one) Give him AP scaling elsewhere on his kit to maybe make him a hybrid?
3. Do something like Fiora's. Every enemy he slays gives off a placement aura that inspires his allies in someway (like a small 500 unit AS, LS, dmg buff, etc.. whatever is the aura for his allies if they stand in it or stand in it for X seconds)
4. Combine 1 and 3. This would of course lead to lower damage or scaling on his ult (like if you switched it to AD) and the kill-aura is noticeable but not outrangous.

As it stands, I live his ult but it just doesn't deliever the fantasy. It's more of "I'm in love with the visuals" than a "In like with gameplay".

**TL;DR: Passive needs rethinking to be more reliable. Q feels unreilable. W feels one-sided. E is great. Ult doesn't deliver fantasy.**

Personally, I think that Aatrox's kit is just fine the way it is currently. Aatrox only really needs his numbers tuned up so that his early game isn't as bad and he can get to snowballing more easily. The problem I've ran into while playing Aatrox is that he has a weak early game that scales into a sub-par mid and late game. As it stands right now, I think that Aatrox can fit into either a tank role or a fighter role, though he doesn't excel at either one in particular. If Aatrox's numbers were tuned up I think he'd fit nicely into a fighter role; but if the balance team has no intention of buffing Aatrox with regards to damage, then add some more durability to his kit and buff his crowd control and label him as a tank. Also, in terms of simple quality of life changes, his Q could stand to have a faster wind up and/or have crowd control affect him at the end of the ability and not during it (similar to Jarvan's dash combo); this would alleviate some frustration about his Q being easy to dodge/easy to cancel.
